title: How to Make a Tire Coffee Table

steps.headline: Find an old tire, preferably around 17 inches (43.2 cm) in diameter.
Go to your junk in your attic or visit a thrift shop and look for a suitable legs for your table.
steps.description: There's no restrictions but it is advisable to find legs that is made of metal. So it can handle the weight of the tire.

steps.headline: Clean the legs and remove rust (if any) using 100 grit sandpaper.
steps.description:
Grab a can of spray paint and color if you wish. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/88\/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/88\/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Measure your tire side wall, you need to cover these with plywood.
Transfer your measurements and cut 2 circular covers for your tire
steps.description:
These will serve as the top and base of your table. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/6a\/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/6a\/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Put a strong adhesive on the side wall.
steps.description:
Place one of the wooden circles on the side wall of the tire and let the adhesive to dry. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/03\/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/03\/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Place your legs in the center of the plywood.
steps.description:
Get some screws (or bolt and nuts){"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/06\/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/06\/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Drill the screw in and secure them. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5c\/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-8Bullet2.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-8Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5c\/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-8Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-8Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Paint the top plywood black and place it on top of the coffee table.
Place your new coffee table on your man-cave!

text:
Find an old tire, preferably around 17 inches (43.2 cm) in diameter. Clean it thoroughly. Go to your junk in your attic or visit a thrift shop and look for a suitable legs for your table. There's no restrictions but it is advisable to find legs that is made of metal. So it can handle the weight of the tire. Clean the legs and remove rust (if any) using 100 grit sandpaper. Grab a can of spray paint and color if you wish. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/88/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/88/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Measure your tire side wall, you need to cover these with plywood. Transfer your measurements and cut 2 circular covers for your tire These will serve as the top and base of your table. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6a/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6a/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Put a strong adhesive on the side wall. Place one of the wooden circles on the side wall of the tire and let the adhesive to dry. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/03/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/03/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Place your legs in the center of the plywood. Get some screws (or bolt and nuts){"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/06/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/06/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Drill the screw in and secure them. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-8Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-8Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-8Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Tire-Coffee-Table-Step-8Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Put your table into position. Paint the top plywood black and place it on top of the coffee table. Place your new coffee table on your man-cave!
